â€œThat is why Chartered Status is so invaluable. Our previous graduates have told us how holding it has helped them to become better in their role, to have greater confidence in working with evidence and have a positive impact on their students.â€
â€œDo not lose that curiosity, that drive to explore the changing shape of evidence. It is about nuance. What works for your situation may not work for the person sitting next to you.â€

â€œEngaging with evidence is so very important to teaching and learning. But equally important is the knowledge that this evidence is not fixedâ€¦ holding Chartered Status is an ongoing commitment to exploring evidence.â€

â€œHow can we best support our students? How can we best support all of you that have shouldered a great deal? While anyone with a microphone or a newspaper column may pontificate about what should happen, it is the experts that should shape the future . You are the experts.â€

â€œThese past two years have placed our profession under immense pressure. Congratulations for all that you have achievedâ€¦ please do not underestimate your achievements. You deserve to be celebratedâ€

@BexN91 Thank you for all of your support and work as a Council Member Rebecca!

@AlisonMPeacock "Whatever comes next for the profession, we will be there to support you, to celebrate your achievements, to connect the profession in the spirit of collegiality. I have great hope for the future and I am excited for the Chartered College members to play a key role. "

@AlisonMPeacock "From the early career teacher setting out on their teaching journey and getting to grips with the ECF to the experienced teacher looking to strengthen their practice and develop and the leader who has contributed so much to the profession - the Chartered College is here..."
@AlisonMPeacock "For an organisation that celebrates only its fifth birthday in January, we have accomplished much. And we have a lot to do. The team and I are very well aware of that..."

@AlisonMPeacock "We need to support teachers to constantly develop and ensure there are career-long opportunities to become informed and to develop criticality. And we need to recognise this expertise. I am pleased that today we can announce our new approach to Chartered Status..."

We're excited to announce our new approach to Chartered Status. Launching in January, you'll have more flexibility to work towards formal accreditation that suits your timetable and professional needs. 

Find out more and start your Chartered journey: https://t.co/AH98YbSnG1 https://t.co/WMrCeIRhD8

@AlisonMPeacock "It is the voice of teachers that is at the heart of our new#FutureOfTeaching book. You have the greatest capacity to make a difference to learners. You are the agents of change..."

https://t.co/Ta4kKtfyqY
@AlisonMPeacock "We need to be listening to what teachers are telling us. But not just paying lip service to these insights, the government needs to act on them..."

@AlisonMPeacock "It all comes back to the question of who are the experts. The answer is perfectly clear - it is you, teachers, who are the experts. You are the ones who are adapting your knowledge, your experiences and applying it to your settings for the benefit of your students...."
@AlisonMPeacock "Our continued growth means we are supporting more teachers than ever...We are an organisation shaped by our members for our members and teachers everywhere..."

@AlisonMPeacock "Time and again the profession has risen to the challenges it faces. And the chartered college of teaching has been by the side of teachers throughout. Supporting you to do what you do best - deliver excellent teaching and change lives."

We open with @AlisonMPeacock's introduction: "We all know how challenging it has been and continues to be. You are doing everything you can to manage these challenges. I want to share my pride in the profession for how it continues to respond..."
